messages.content: noEmbryo is a diverse set of nodes for ComfyUI that includes PromptTermList (1-6), Resolution Scale, and Regex Text Chopper.
How can you access the noEmbryo nodes in ComfyUI?
You can access the noEmbryo nodes through the 'Add node > noEmbryo' submenu in ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of PromptTermList nodes in noEmbryo?
The PromptTermList nodes in noEmbryo help with the creation of Prompts inside ComfyUI.
How many PromptTermList nodes are available in noEmbryo and what do they use to store prompt terms?
There are 6 PromptTermList nodes available in noEmbryo, and each node uses a different `json` file to store its prompt terms in 'label'/ 'value' pairs.
What is the function of the Resolution Scale node in noEmbryo?
The Resolution Scale node in noEmbryo outputs the resolution of an image using the dimensions of an input image or some custom user-defined dimensions, using a Scale Factor.
How does the Resolution Scale node handle the scaling of images with only one dimension provided?
If there is an input image connected, setting either 'width' or 'height' to 0 will use the other dimension to scale the image (but always multiple of 4).
What does the Regex Text Chopper node in noEmbryo do?
The Regex Text Chopper node in noEmbryo 'chops' a text using a regular expression and outputs the chopped parts of the text.
How can you install noEmbryo nodes in ComfyUI?
You can install noEmbryo nodes in ComfyUI using the ComfyUI Manager or manually by cloning the repository in the 'ComfyUI\custom_nodes' directory and restarting ComfyUI.
